message.blood_moon_rising.demo_welcome: Thank you for playing an early demo version of the Blood Moon Rising mod by TrashElemental! Keep in mind most features are currently unfinished, and very little, if any at all, of the mod's content will be obtainable in a survival world. For any questions or feedback, please head to TrashElemental's discord server (where you should have found this download) or the GitHub wiki. This mod may be unsuitable for players below a certain age or those who are disturbed by themes of blood magic, mild horror, and violence. This message can be disabled via Config.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.astral_heart_d: Empowers and fortifies equipment made from Wound materials and prevents 'fail' outcomes of certain rituals.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.broken_heart_d: Drastically raises attack power at the cost of more max health.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.dividing_heart: Spawns Morsels when you take damage, which can attack your enemies or be consumed to recoup some health and hunger.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.echoing_heart_: Damage you deal will echo, causing the hit entity to take half the original damage again after a short delay.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.elusive_heart_: Raises movement speed and jump height, and grants fall damage immunity. When attacked, you have a small chance to avoid the damage. The chance increases each time you take damage, and is reset when it activates.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.feral_heart_de: Consuming raw meat grants a surge of power, and slaying enemies will restore health and hunger.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.frantic_heart_: Taking damage grants a short burst of increased move and attack speed.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.frozen_heart_d: Grants immunity to freezing, and can crouch to freeze nearby water. Your attacks cause freeze buildup, and inflict slowness on enemies that are sufficiently frozen.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.heavy_heart_de: Grants some innate armor and toughness that stacks with any worn armor, at the cost of a minor speed penalty.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.hungry_heart_d: Food items are consumed faster and are worth more, and heartier meals will give Health Boost. Prevents negative effects that would be given by food.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.scorched_heart: Grants immunity to fire. Taking damage will set your attacker on fire, and your attacks may also ignite enemies.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.selfless_heart: Interact with a mob that is missing health while crouching to restore some of its health, at the cost of some of your own. Periodically apply Regeneration to nearby allies.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.spiteful_heart: When you are attacked, your attacker will take a small amount of damage in retaliation.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.tainted_heart_: Grants immunity to Poison and Corrosion, and your attacks inflict poison. When you take damage, gain the Leaking effect, causing you to leave behind a caustic trail of bile.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.wrathful_heart: Slaying an enemy grants a short burst of increased attack speed and damage.
message.blood_moon_rising.heart_equip_fa: You already have that Heart equipped!
enchantment.blood_moon_rising.jagged_edg: Attacks have a chance to inflict a level of Hemorrhage, which deals a burst of damage when it reaches level three. Durability drains faster when inflicting Hemorrhage.
enchantment.blood_moon_rising.adrenaline: Increases attack damage when your health is low.
enchantment.blood_moon_rising.last_stand: Decreases incoming damage when your health is low.
effect.blood_moon_rising.hemorrhage.desc: This effect can be applied by certain weapons, or a weapon enchanted with the Jagged Edge Enchantment. While at level one or two, this effect does nothing, but re-applying the effect will increase its level. When the effect reaches level 3, it will be cleared, and the affected mob will take 1/4 of its maximum health (or 15, whichever is lower) as damage. The affected mob will be slowed and weakened for a few seconds.
effect.blood_moon_rising.berserk.descrip: This effect can be applied by using certain weapons or items. When applied, the affected mob's attack speed, movement speed, and attack damage will be increased. Killing an entity will extend the effect, to a maximum of 12 seconds. Once the effect expires, you will need a few seconds to recover, and gain the Exhaustion effect.
effect.blood_moon_rising.exhaustion.desc: This effect is applied when the Berserk effect wears off on an entity. When applied, the affected mob's attack speed, movement speed, and attack damage are reduced.
effect.blood_moon_rising.health_down_des: This effect reduces an entity's max health value by 4 (two hearts) per level.
effect.blood_moon_rising.corrosion_descr: This effect covers the affected entity in a corrosive acid that causes them to take 15% more damage per level from all sources, and their armor will degrade faster.
effect.blood_moon_rising.kinship_descrip: This effect causes most normally hostile mobs from The Wound to not immediately view you as a threat, or in some cases view you as a potential ally.
effect.blood_moon_rising.scorn_descripti: This effect enrages mobs from the Wound, causing normally neutral mobs to attack you on sight.
effect.blood_moon_rising.leaking_descrip: This effect causes you to leave a caustic trail of bile as you move, which damages and inflicts Corrosion on other entities.
message.blood_moon_rising.berserk_fail: You're too exhausted to go berserk!
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.multiplying_mo: Consume to convert some of your hunger into 1-2 Morsels.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.fleam: Use to sacrifice some of your health to spawn a Morsel minion. Interact with a Morsel to consume it and regain some health and hunger. Shift-use the Fleam to consume all nearby Morsels.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.parasite_eggs: Use to sacrifice a small amount of health to spawn 2-3 mosquitoes, or leeches if you are in the water. These parasites will seek out the nearest enemy, and return to heal you.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.bolus: Use on an animal to instantly grow a baby to an adult, or instantly cause an adult animal to breed, regardless of how recently it has bred. Can also be used as a superior bonemeal alternative, which even works on Nether Wart.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.jawblade: Attacking with this weapon will build up precious ichor on the blade. When it is fully drenched, you can use it to enter a Berserk state for as long as you continue to slay enemies. When the effect wears off, you will need to recover for a short time.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.butchers_cleav: Attacking with this weapon will build up precious ichor on the blade. When it is fully drenched, you can use it to regain some health and gain a short burst of power.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.sacrificial_da: Sacrifice your health to this weapon to increase its attack power for a certain number of attacks. Additionally, slaying a creature near an Exultation Font with this weapon may appease the Wound and delay the next Blood Moon.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.warham: A weapon that doubles as food. Take some bites from it to trade some of its durability for a meal.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.sanguine_chali: Fill the chalice with precious ichor by slaying enemies, and drink it when full to regain health (or gain Absorption if you are at max health.) Use with a potion in your off-hand to set a secondary effect that the chalice will bestow when used. Use with a bucket of milk to clear any set effect.
Chalice could not accept the potion.
Chalice was cleared of any potion.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.sacred_spear: This trident can be used to fire projectiles that have a chance to inflict Hemorrhage. Crouch-use the item to charge up a powerful incantation that will instantly Hemorrhage all nearby creatures that are not tamed by you, healing yourself for each affected entity. Doing this consumes a chunk of the weapon's durability, and the ability cannot be used again until residual power is dispersed by attacking.
tooltip.blood_moon_rising.augur: Use to divine the number of nights until the next Blood Moon. If used during a Blood Moon, will highlight nearby interlopers from The Wound.
message.blood_moon_rising.augur_fail: The Blood Moon has set... for now.
message.blood_moon_rising.augur_read_cou: The Augur shudders... a Blood Moon is imminent.
message.blood_moon_rising.blood_moon_end: The Blood Moon sets... for now.
message.blood_moon_rising.blood_moon_sle: Your heart is racing. You cannot rest tonight.
